Instructions.prep1: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add some salt.
Instructions.prep2: Add the oil to a fry pan and gently heat over medium-low.
Instructions.prep3: Peel the garlic and slice thinly (1mm).
Instructions.prep4: Roughly chop the parsley into small pieces.
Instructions.prep6: Squeeze the lemon to extract the fresh lemon juice.
Instructions.step1: Add the spaghetti to the boiling water for 8-10 minutes. Once finished cooking, drain immediately.
Instructions.step2: Add garlic slices to the frying pan and gently toast, stirring occasionally until golden brown.
Instructions.step3: Add the chili flakes, salt and pepper to taste into the drained pasta.
Instructions.step4: Pour the olive oil, garlic, parsley and half of the Parmigiano-Reggiano over the pasta.
Instructions.step5: Stir until combined. Adjust seasoning to taste
Instructions.step6: Serve pasta with remaining Parmigiano-Reggiano sprinkled on top.

Instructions.prep1: Dough: Combine the flour, salt, yeast and whisk together until combined.
Instructions.prep2: Dough: Add the lukewarm water and mix together for 1-2 minutes for it to come together. Cover in plastic wrap and leave at room temperature for 18-24 hours.
Instructions.step1: Sauce: Add the oil to a frying pan on medium-low heat
Instructions.step2: Sauce: Peel the garlic and chop roughly into small pieces.
Instructions.step3: Sauce: Add the garlic to the frying pan and cook gently for 1 minute until fragrant but not brown. Add the chili flakes and cook for a further 20 seconds.
Instructions.step4: Sauce: Pour in the whole tinned tomatoes and start to break them.
Instructions.step5: Sauce: Add the onion powder and oregano and simmer for 25-30 minutes on medium heat.
Instructions.step6: Sauce: If desired, use a hand blender to pur√©e until smooth, alternatively squash the tomatoes in the pan until desired consistency.
Instructions.step7: Once ready to work the dough, preheat the oven to its maximum setting for 30-40 minutes.
Instructions.step8: Dough: Flour the work surface and start to roll the dough around to form a ball.
Instructions.step9: Dough: Portion the dough into 4 pieces by cutting the ball.
Instructions.step10: Dough: Sprinkle the semonlina or flour onto your baking tray and add a portion of dough to it.
Instructions.step11: Dough: Gently shape the dough into the desired shape. Take care not to knock too much air out and do not use a rolling pin.
Instructions.step12: Sauce: Add 2 tablespoons of the sauce to the dough and spread evenly over the pizza dough. Be relatively conservative with the sauce, try not to add more than necessary to cover.
Instructions.step13: Rip the fresh mozzarella cheese and place onto the pizza. Aim for pools of mozzarella and try not to add too much as this can spoil the crust.
Instructions.step14: Rip 5-6 basil leaves and top the pizza with them.
Instructions.step15: Before placing in the oven, gently shake the baking tray to ensure the pizza will release. If it sticks, try to gently lift and add more semolina / flour.
Instructions.step16: Place the pizza into the oven for 7-9 minutes until the cheese is golden.
